title: feat: add option to send message with missing replies
body:
## Please make sure to check the following tasks before opening and submitting a PR

- [x] I understand and have followed the [contribution guide](https://github.com/revoltchat/.github/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [x] I have tested my changes locally and they are working as intended

Adds an optional `fail_if_not_exists` attribute to the send message reply object, If set to `false`, and the message referenced by `id` doesn't exist, the message will be sent normally, without the reply. If set to `true`, or omitted, the current behaviour is preserved, where the message will fail to send.

## `POST` `/channels/ABC/messages`

```diff
{
    "content": "Hello",
    "replies": [
        {
            "id": "12345",
            "mention": false,
+           "fail_if_not_exists": false
        }
    ]
}
```

title: feat: allow to set an icon when creating a group chat
body:
This PR adds the ability to change the group icon when creating a group chat.

The frontend would have to set the "icon" field when creating a new group to set the icon. Where "icon" contains the id of a previously uploaded icon. If you don't want to set an icon, do not add the field to the request.

Fixes #220

title: Add Mass Mentions to the backend
body:
This adds support for Mass Mentions to the backend.
This allows for the mentioning of roles, @ everyone, and @ online.

Currently the following permission bits are used (subject to change):
    `MentionEveryone = 1 << 37` (@ everyone / @ online )
    `MentionRoles = 1 << 38`

The following message flags have been added for bot use:
        `MentionsEveryone = 1 << 2`
        `MentionsOnline = 1 << 3`
Note that the two are mutually exclusive, and MentionsEveryone takes precedence over MentionsOnline.
Additionally, the SuppressNotifications flag actually works now.

This PR involves updating the mongodb driver to V3.1.
This PR involves updating authifier to V1.0.10.

The format is as follows:
- @ everyone (without the space) - pings everyone that can see the channel
- @ online (without the space) - pings everyone who can see the channel and is online
- <%roleid> - pings everyone with the role that can see the channel.

title: Add push notification daemon for proper handling of push notifications
body:
This PR adds pushd, the new push notification daemon. It also adds rabbitmq as a required component for running the backend, which will be considered a breaking change for selfhosting (as it modifies existing config keys).

title: cross compile arm64 / amd64 images
body:
## Please make sure to check the following tasks before opening and submitting a PR

* [x] I understand and have followed the [contribution guide](https://github.com/revoltchat/revolt/discussions/282)
* [x] I have tested my changes locally and they are working as intended
* [x] These changes do not have any notable side effects on other Revolt projects

---

Hello! I've got a preliminary cross-compilation (`amd64`/`arm64`) setup going with the `base`, `bonfire`, and `delta` container images here. Testing has been a bit wonky, but all six images are building on my local M1 machine.

With cross compilation, `buildx` of `base` for both platforms takes about **10 minutes** for me vs **???** with emulation 😄.

I plan to create a separate branch and try triggering some build and push Actions on my fork, but wanted to get the work out there sooner for comment in case my removal of `cargo install` in the separate service images was going to cause problems.

✌️

title: feat: concurrently query January for embeds
body:

the concurrent amount is configurable via `JANUARY_CONCURRENT_CONNECTIONS`
